arts.ttl: Alex Neil: Millwall ran themselves into the ground to claim win at Sheffield United
arts.sum: Mihailo Ivanovic should have extended Neil’s side’s lead in the 57th minute, but he rushed his chance one-on-one with Michael Cooper after being played through by Coburn. “We knew that playing a front two was going to give us a threat but we would be one man down in the middle, but it was a risk worth taking with where we are in the league and with the number of games left.

arts.ttl: Sheffield United 0-1 Millwall: Blades Lack Cutting Edge Once More As They Slip to Third
arts.sum: Sheffield United suffered back-to-back defeats on Tuesday evening as Millwall kept their Championship play-off dreams alive. The match-winning goal came from Josh Coburn in the 21st minute as the towering striker spun on the ball inside the penalty area and smashed it beyond a helpless Michael Cooper. arts.ttl: Millwall strike blow to Sheff Utd's promotion hopes
arts.sum: Josh Coburn's first-half strike clinched play-off chasing Millwall a 1-0 win at Bramall Lane and dented Sheffield United's automatic promotion chances.

arts.ttl: Sheffield United suffer further promotion setback after defeat to Millwall
arts.sum: Josh Coburn netted the only goal for the Lions.

arts.ttl: Millwall legends help with podcast fundraiser for Cancer Research UK
arts.sum: The current squad also signed some and these can be purchased at Chat with Chaps CRUK Charity T Shirts – Nolu Clothing with all profits going to Cancer Research. Millwall legends Neil Harris, Lee Gregory and Steve Morison have signed t-shirts for a Millwall podcast on a fundraising drive to help battle cancer.

arts.ttl: Chris Wilder Issues Rallying Cry Ahead of Sheffield United vs Millwall Clash
arts.sum: Sheffield United manager Chris Wilder has urged fans to get behind the team as the Blades prepare to face Millwall in a must-win Championship fixture at Bramall Lane. Following a shock 1-0 defeat away to Oxford United – their first road loss since New Year’s Day – the Blades missed the chance to pull four […] The post Chris Wilder Issues Rallying Cry Ahead of Sheffield United vs Millwall Clash appeared first on Sheff United Way.

arts.ttl: Sheffield United boss hits out ahead of Championship crunch game against Millwall
arts.sum: “I think it (the reaction of some of the fanbase at Oxford) is an absolute disgrace to the players that represent the football club and what they’ve done this season. If that’s what you think of the players then when we have the good days don’t be clapping – go home.
